other_tests.findings: Lipid-laden macrophages with oil drops on the surface of the fluid.

other_tests.procedure_name: Nuclear magnetic resonance and infrared spectrometry
other_tests.findings: Concentration of vaseline oil in lung secretions was measured to be 44 mg/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Concentration of vaseline oil decreased to 4 mg/ml by Day 51.

other_tests.findings: Repeated lavages until the effluent solution appeared to be free of lipid, cumulative lavage volume was approximately 20 l/lung.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Marked improvement in lung aeration observed on whole-lung CT scan on Day 55.

other_tests.procedure_name: Microscopic examination of fluid from bronchoalveolar lavages
other_tests.findings: Cycle of intracellular oil, then extracellular oil was noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The presence of oil was observed both intracellularly and extracellularly across several days.
